title: Jelly Roll Morton - His Complete Victor Recordings (5 CDs)
description:
THE JELLY ROLL MORTON CENTENNIAL: HIS COMPLETE VICTOR RECORDINGS

(new rip + scans)

DISC 1:

Tracks 1-18:

Jelly Roll Morton's Red Hot Peppers
George Mitchell - cornet
Kid Ory - trombone
Omer Simeon - clarinet, bass clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Johnny St. Cyr - banjo
John Lindsay - bass
Andrew Hilaire - drums

Barney Bigard - clarinet (5-9)
Darnell Howard - clarinet (5-8)
Marty Bloom - effects 
Morton and St. Cyr - dialogue

J. Wright Smith - violin (10-11)
Clarence Black - violin (10-11)
Morton - vocal (10-11)

Recorded September 15 (1-4), September 21 (5-9) & December 16 (10-18), 1926, at the Webster Hotel, Chicago

Tracks 19-22:

Jelly Roll Morton's Red Hot Peppers
George Mitchell - cornet
Gerald Reeves - trombone
Johnny Dodds - clarinet
Paul "Stump" Evans - alto sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Bud Scott - guitar
Quinn Wilson - tuba
Baby Dodds - drums

Lew LeMar - vocal comments (19-20)

Recorded June 4, 1927 at Victor Talking Machine Recording Laboratory, Chicago

DISC 2:

Tracks 1-8:

Jelly Roll Morton's Red Hot Peppers
George Mitchell - cornet
Gerald Reeves - trombone
Johnny Dodds - clarinet
Paul "Stump" Evans - alto sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Bud Scott - guitar
Quinn Wilson - tuba
Baby Dodds - drums

Jelly Roll Morton - vocal comments (1-2)

Recorded June 4 (1-4) & June 10 (5-8), 1927, at Victor Talking Machine Recording Laboratory, Chicago

Tracks 9-11:

Jelly Roll Morton Trio
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Johnny Dodds - clarinet
Baby Dodds - drums

Recorded June 10 (5-8), 1927, at Victor Talking Machine Recording Laboratory, Chicago

Tracks 12-18:

Jelly Roll Morton's Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet (12-15)
Greechie Fields - trombone (12-15, 18)
Omer Simeon - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Lee Blair - banjo (12-15)
Bill Benford - tuba (12-15)
Tommy Benford - drums

Recorded June 11, 1928 at Liederkranz Hall, NYC

Tracks 19-20:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Orchestra
Edward Anderson - trumpet
Edwin Swayze - trumpet
William Kato - trombone
Russell Procope - clarinet, alto sax
Paul Barnes - soprano sax
Joe Garland - tenor sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Lee Blair - Banjo
William Moore - tuba
Manzie Johnson - drums

Recorded Dec 6, 1928 at Victor 46th Street Studio, NYC

Tracks 21-23:

Jelly Roll Morton - solo piano

Recorded July 8, 1929 at Studio #1, Camden, NJ

Disc 3:

Tracks 1-3:

Jelly Roll Morton - solo piano

Recorded July 8, 1929 at Studio #1, Camden, NJ

Tracks 4-17:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Orchestra
David Richard - trumpet
Boyd "Red" Rosser - trumpet
Charlie Irvis - trombone
George Baquet - clarinet
Paul Barnes - soprano sax
Walter Thomas - alto sax
Joe Thomas - tenor sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Barney Alexander - banjo
Harry Prather - tuba
William Laws - drums

Recorded July 9 (4-9), 10 (10-13) & 12 (14-17), 1929 at Studio #1, Camden, NJ

Tracks 18-21:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Henry "Red" Allen - trumpet
J.C. Higginbotham - trombone
Albert Nicholas - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Will Johnson - guitar
Pops Foster - bass
Paul Barbarin - drums

Recorded Nov 13, 1929 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

DISC 4:

Tracks 1-3:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Henry "Red" Allen - trumpet
J.C. Higginbotham - trombone
Albert Nicholas - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Will Johnson - guitar
Pops Foster - bass
Paul Barbarin - drums

Recorded Nov 13, 1929 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

Tracks 4-7:

Jelly Roll Morton Trio
Barney Bigard - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Zutty Singleton - drums

Recorded Dec 17, 1929 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

Tracks 8-12:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
unknown - trumpet
Wilbur de Paris - trombone
Ernie Bullock (possibly) - clarinet, bass clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Bernard Addison - guitar
Billy Taylor - bass
Cozy Cole - drums

Recorded March 5, 1930 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

Tracks 13-16:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
Bubber Miley - trumpet
Wilbur de Paris - trombone
unknown - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Bernard Addison - guitar
Bill Benford - tuba
Tommy Benford - drums

Recorded March 19 (13-14) & 20 (15-16), 1930 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

Tracks 17-22:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
unknown - trumpet
Geechie Fields - trombone
unknown - clarinet, alto sax
Walter Thomas - alto & baritone sax
Joe Thomas - clarinet, tenor sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Lee Blair - piano
Billy Taylor - tuba
Cozy Cole - drums

Recorded June 2, 1930 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

DISC 5:

Tracks 1-2:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
unknown - trumpet
Geechie Fields - trombone
unknown - clarinet, alto sax
Walter Thomas - alto & baritone sax
Joe Thomas - clarinet, tenor sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Lee Blair - piano
Billy Taylor - tuba
Cozy Cole - drums

Recorded June 2, 1930 at Victor 46th Street Studio, New York City

Tracks 3-8:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
Geechie Fields - trombone
Albert Nicholas - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Howard Hill - guitar
Pete Biggs - tuba
Tommy Benford - drums

Recorded July 14, 130 at Studio 2, 24th Street, NYC

Tracks 9-11:

Jelly Roll Morton And His Red Hot Peppers
Ward Pinkett - trumpet
Geechie Fields - trombone
unknown - clarinet
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Bernard Addison - guitar
Billy Taylor - tuba
Bill Beason - drums

Recorded Oct 9, 1930 at Studio 2, NYC

Tracks 12-23:

Jelly Roll Morton's New Orleans Jazzmen
Sydney de Paris - trumpet
Claude Jones - trombone (12-17)
Fred Robinson - trombone (18-23)
Albert Nicholas - clarinet
Sydney Bechet - soprano sax (12-17)
Happy Caldwell - tenor sax
Jelly Roll Morton - piano
Lawrence Lucie - guitar
Wellman Braud - bass
Singleton - drums

Jelly Roll Morton - preaching (12), vocals (15-17, 20-21, 23)
Singleton - preaching (13)

Recorded September 14 (12-17) & 28 (18-23). 1939 at Victor Studio 3, New York

Reissue produced by Orrin Keepnews
Digital transfers and audio retoration by Paul Goodman
"NoNOISE" processing by Sonic Solutions
1990 RCA/BMG
